intro: Psychotria stenocarpa subsp. montivaga, commonly known as the mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
